intro: Torilis stricta, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, winged fruits called siliques. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Torilis stricta is known for its ability to tolerate a range of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural settings.
